title-group.article-title: Probability of Loss and the Capital Asset Pricing Model

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 1977 Board of Regents of the University of Wisconsin System

abstract.p: This paper relates probability of loss as a risk criterion to the equilibrium results of the capital asset pricing model. It is shown that these equilibrium results are equivalent to the probability of loss criterion, for both the valuation of securities and for capital expenditure decisions at the level of the firm. A general integer programming model for capital expenditure planning is presented which is consistent with the capital asset pricing model. This model is compared with various safety first models which have previously been developed in the literature. Empirical evidence about the behavior of executives in risky choice situations is also cited which supports the probability of loss criterion. In addition some of the problems of implementing the criterion in practice are discussed.
